Reason Meghan and Harry were 'forbidden' from staying with Queen last Christmas

Meghan Markle and Prince Harry weren't allowed to stay with the Queen last Christmas, a source claims - here's why

View 2 Images The couple stayed at Anmer Hall last year (Image: Getty Images)

News of where Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will spend this Christmas has been eagerly awaited by royal fans.

‌



Now it's been reported the Duke and Duchess of Sussex will be staying at the Queen's Sandringham estate this Christmas - where they'll be "packed like sardines" among the monarch's nearest and dearest.

‌



The couple won't be staying at William and Kate's nearby Anmer Hall this Christmas, unlike last year when the 'Fab Four' spent festivities together at the Georgian country home.

‌



And it turns out, there may be a reason the couple weren't allowed to stay with the Queen at her Norfolk estate last year - and it's all down to royal protocol.

View 2 Images (Image: AFP/Getty Images)

‌



A source suggested to the Mail on Sunday the Sussexes stayed at Anmer Hall last year because at that point they hadn't tied the knot.

Royal protocol dictates it is inappropriate for unmarried couples to stay in the main house - which is apparently why the couple would have been forbidden from sleeping there, rather than because of any particular issue.

Inviting Meghan to the festivities was already a break in convention, so Anmer Hall offered the "perfect solution".

‌



But their marriage changed everything. It would now be unusual, according to the royal insider, for the couple not to stay with the Queen.

Nevertheless, the move will inevitably fuel further speculation about a rift between the two couples.

Rumours of tensions between Kate and Meghan have plagued the royal family for the past few months, as insiders have claimed they are "very different people".
